column2: Complete the sentences with a preposition (in, for, with etc.).
column3: He's very brave. He's not afraid {{c1::of}} anything.

column2: Complete the sentences with a preposition (in, for, with etc.).
column3: Don't ask me to decide. I'm not good {{c1::at}} making decisions.

column2: Complete the sentences with a preposition (in, for, with etc.).
column3: Some people say that Sue is unfriendly, but she's always very nice {{c1::to}} me.

column2: Complete the sentences with a preposition (in, for, with etc.).
column3: What do you think is the best solution {{c1::to|for}} the problem?

column2: Complete the sentences with a preposition (in, for, with etc.).
column3: There has been a big increase {{c1::in}} the price of oil recently.

column2: Complete the sentences with a preposition (in, for, with etc.).
column3: He lives a rather lonely life. He doesn't have much contact {{c1::with}} other people.

column2: Complete the sentences with a preposition (in, for, with etc.).
column3: Paul is a keen photographer. He likes taking pictures {{c1::of}} people.

column2: Complete the sentences with a preposition (in, for, with etc.).
column3: Michael got married {{c1::to}} a woman he met when he was studying at college.

column2: Complete the sentences with a preposition (in, for, with etc.).
column3: The plan has been changed, but nobody seems to know the reason {{c1::for}} this.

column2: Complete the sentences with a preposition (in, for, with etc.).
column3: I'm surprised {{c1::at|by}} the traffic today. I didn't think it would be so busy.

column2: Complete the sentences with a preposition (in, for, with etc.).
column3: Thank you for lending me the guidebook. It was full {{c1::of}} useful information.

column2: Complete the sentences with a preposition (in, for, with etc.).
column3: I'm afraid I've had to change my plans, so I can't meet you tomorrow. I'm sorry {{c1::about}} that.
